001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of
003// the WPILib BSD license file in the root directory of this project.
004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command;
006
007import java.util.Enumeration;
008
009/**
010 * A {@link ConditionalCommand} is a {@link Command} that starts one of two commands.
011 *
012 * <p>A {@link ConditionalCommand} uses m_condition to determine whether it should run m_onTrue or
013 * m_onFalse.
014 *
015 * <p>A {@link ConditionalCommand} adds the proper {@link Command} to the {@link Scheduler} during
016 * {@link ConditionalCommand#initialize()} and then {@link ConditionalCommand#isFinished()} will
017 * return true once that {@link Command} has finished executing.
018 *
019 * <p>If no {@link Command} is specified for m_onFalse, the occurrence of that condition will be a
020 * no-op.
021 *
022 * <p>A ConditionalCommand will require the superset of subsystems of the onTrue and onFalse
023 * commands.
024 *
025 * <p>This class is provided by the OldCommands VendorDep
026 *
027 * @see Command
028 * @see Scheduler
029 */
030public abstract class ConditionalCommand extends Command {
031  /** The Command to execute if {@link ConditionalCommand#condition()} returns true. */
032  private Command m_onTrue;
033
034  /** The Command to execute if {@link ConditionalCommand#condition()} returns false. */
035  private Command m_onFalse;
036
037  /** Stores command chosen by condition. */
038  private Command m_chosenCommand;
039
040  private void requireAll() {
041    if (m_onTrue != null) {
042      for (Enumeration<?> e = m_onTrue.getRequirements(); e.hasMoreElements(); ) {
043        requires((Subsystem) e.nextElement());
044      }
045    }
046
047    if (m_onFalse != null) {
048      for (Enumeration<?> e = m_onFalse.getRequirements(); e.hasMoreElements(); ) {
049        requires((Subsystem) e.nextElement());
050      }
051    }
052  }
053
054  /**
055   * Creates a new ConditionalCommand with given onTrue and onFalse Commands.
056   *
057   * <p>Users of this constructor should also override condition().
058   *
059   * @param onTrue The Command to execute if {@link ConditionalCommand#condition()} returns true
060   */
061  public ConditionalCommand(Command onTrue) {
062    this(onTrue, null);
063  }
064
065  /**
066   * Creates a new ConditionalCommand with given onTrue and onFalse Commands.
067   *
068   * <p>Users of this constructor should also override condition().
069   *
070   * @param onTrue The Command to execute if {@link ConditionalCommand#condition()} returns true
071   * @param onFalse The Command to execute if {@link ConditionalCommand#condition()} returns false
072   */
073  public ConditionalCommand(Command onTrue, Command onFalse) {
074    m_onTrue = onTrue;
075    m_onFalse = onFalse;
076
077    requireAll();
078  }
079
080  /**
081   * Creates a new ConditionalCommand with given name and onTrue and onFalse Commands.
082   *
083   * <p>Users of this constructor should also override condition().
084   *
085   * @param name the name for this command group
086   * @param onTrue The Command to execute if {@link ConditionalCommand#condition()} returns true
087   */
088  public ConditionalCommand(String name, Command onTrue) {
089    this(name, onTrue, null);
090  }
091
092  /**
093   * Creates a new ConditionalCommand with given name and onTrue and onFalse Commands.
094   *
095   * <p>Users of this constructor should also override condition().
096   *
097   * @param name the name for this command group
098   * @param onTrue The Command to execute if {@link ConditionalCommand#condition()} returns true
099   * @param onFalse The Command to execute if {@link ConditionalCommand#condition()} returns false
100   */
101  public ConditionalCommand(String name, Command onTrue, Command onFalse) {
102    super(name);
103    m_onTrue = onTrue;
104    m_onFalse = onFalse;
105
106    requireAll();
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * The Condition to test to determine which Command to run.
111   *
112   * @return true if m_onTrue should be run or false if m_onFalse should be run.
113   */
114  protected abstract boolean condition();
115
116  /** Calls {@link ConditionalCommand#condition()} and runs the proper command. */
117  @Override
118  protected void _initialize() {
119    if (condition()) {
120      m_chosenCommand = m_onTrue;
121    } else {
122      m_chosenCommand = m_onFalse;
123    }
124
125    if (m_chosenCommand != null) {
126      /*
127       * This is a hack to make canceling the chosen command inside a
128       * CommandGroup work properly
129       */
130      m_chosenCommand.clearRequirements();
131
132      m_chosenCommand.start();
133    }
134    super._initialize();
135  }
136
137  @Override
138  protected synchronized void _cancel() {
139    if (m_chosenCommand != null && m_chosenCommand.isRunning()) {
140      m_chosenCommand.cancel();
141    }
142
143    super._cancel();
144  }
145
146  @Override
147  protected boolean isFinished() {
148    if (m_chosenCommand != null) {
149      return m_chosenCommand.isCompleted();
150    } else {
151      return true;
152    }
153  }
154
155  @Override
156  protected void _interrupted() {
157    if (m_chosenCommand != null && m_chosenCommand.isRunning()) {
158      m_chosenCommand.cancel();
159    }
160
161    super._interrupted();
162  }
163}
